data:
1
00:00:02,127 --> 00:00:03,837
Hold it right there!

2
00:00:05,964 --> 00:00:06,923
Johnny?

3
00:00:10,010 --> 00:00:11,344
It's been so damn long,

4
00:00:11,344 --> 00:00:13,513
I thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

5
00:00:14,681 --> 00:00:16,141
You son of a gun!

6
00:00:19,519 --> 00:00:20,770
Uncle Karl...

7
00:00:23,857 --> 00:00:24,858
Wait.

8
00:00:27,694 --> 00:00:29,863
-Is that me?
-Yeah.

9
00:00:38,163 --> 00:00:39,873
Shell Beach is where
I grew up?

10
00:00:39,956 --> 00:00:42,542
That's what I said.
Shell Beach.

11
00:00:42,625 --> 00:00:45,045
-Your home town.
-I need to get there.

12
00:00:45,045 --> 00:00:46,129
How do I get there?

13
00:00:47,547 --> 00:00:50,467
I don't know.
I haven't been there in years.

14
00:00:50,508 --> 00:00:53,386
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

15
00:00:55,347 --> 00:00:56,556
Sorry, Johnny.

16
00:00:58,016 --> 00:01:00,560
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

17
00:01:04,356 --> 00:01:07,817
-It was so bright there.
-Brighter times, I guess.

18
00:01:09,569 --> 00:01:12,864
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

19
00:01:12,906 --> 00:01:14,866
That's me and your Pa.

20
00:01:14,908 --> 00:01:17,243
What a couple of
handsome fools.

21
00:01:17,243 --> 00:01:18,828
What happened to my parents?

22
00:01:21,373 --> 00:01:22,499
Where are they now?

23
00:01:23,750 --> 00:01:25,543
They're dead, Johnny.

24
00:01:25,585 --> 00:01:28,338
They died when the house
burned down.

25
00:01:28,380 --> 00:01:30,006
I looked after you.

26
00:01:30,924 --> 00:01:32,676
You don't remember that,
really?

27
00:01:35,512 --> 00:01:38,014
What's that? What is that?

28
00:01:43,853 --> 00:01:45,730
It's a scar.

29
00:01:45,730 --> 00:01:48,066
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

30
00:01:53,613 --> 00:01:55,198
What does it mean?

31
00:01:55,240 --> 00:01:57,242
It means these are all lies!

32
00:02:01,287 --> 00:02:03,623
My husband told me
he'd been here.

33
00:02:03,707 --> 00:02:06,459
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

34
00:02:06,543 --> 00:02:08,795
See if he was...

35
00:02:08,878 --> 00:02:11,214
capable of...

36
00:02:20,098 --> 00:02:21,933
I wanted to talk to her.

37
00:02:21,975 --> 00:02:23,935
I thought she could
help me find him.

38
00:02:25,645 --> 00:02:27,647
I'm going to call the station.

39
00:02:43,788 --> 00:02:44,998
It's beautiful.

40
00:02:47,667 --> 00:02:50,503
It was a gift from my mother.

41
00:02:50,587 --> 00:02:52,130
She died recently.

42
00:02:53,506 --> 00:02:55,800
I keep it with me
to remind me of her.

43
00:02:57,927 --> 00:02:58,970
I'm sorry.

44
00:03:02,640 --> 00:03:04,768
It's a funny thing, though.

45
00:03:04,809 --> 00:03:07,270
I can't remember
when she gave it to me.

46
00:03:09,689 --> 00:03:12,150
How do you think I could
forget a thing like that?

47
00:03:13,651 --> 00:03:16,112
What's happening, lnspector?

48
00:03:16,154 --> 00:03:17,947
I'm not sure I know anymore.

49
00:03:21,951 --> 00:03:23,703
I left your old room
like it was.

50
00:03:24,704 --> 00:03:26,998
You can sleep here tonight.

51
00:03:27,040 --> 00:03:29,167
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

52
00:03:29,167 --> 00:03:31,961
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

53
00:03:33,046 --> 00:03:35,715
-Is that the right time?
-Why, sure.

54
00:03:35,799 --> 00:03:38,218
That clock's kept perfect time
since I bought it.

55
00:03:38,218 --> 00:03:39,552
A.M. or P.M.?

56
00:03:41,221 --> 00:03:43,682
-What do you think?
-I don't understand.

57
00:03:43,682 --> 00:03:46,476
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

58
00:03:46,518 --> 00:03:49,020
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

59
00:03:50,689 --> 00:03:51,690
Get some sleep.

60
00:03:51,690 --> 00:03:54,192
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

61
00:04:26,307 --> 00:04:27,559
Come on...

62
00:04:47,954 --> 00:04:50,957
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

63
00:04:50,999 --> 00:04:53,376
I know. He's not himself.

64
00:04:53,418 --> 00:04:55,462
Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

65
00:04:55,503 --> 00:04:57,756
-I'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

66
00:05:01,301 --> 00:05:04,679
I can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

67
00:05:05,430 --> 00:05:08,266
We just wanted to help.

68
00:05:14,981 --> 00:05:18,610
Karl. Uncle Karl.

69
00:05:18,651 --> 00:05:22,113
If you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

70
00:05:23,573 --> 00:05:26,076
Haven't seen you in so long.

71
00:06:40,650 --> 00:06:45,321
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

72
00:06:50,160 --> 00:06:52,537
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

73
00:06:52,579 --> 00:06:56,166
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

74
00:06:56,207 --> 00:06:57,542
What are you talking about?

75
00:06:57,584 --> 00:07:00,670
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

76
00:07:00,712 --> 00:07:04,466
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

77
00:07:04,507 --> 00:07:08,553
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

78
00:07:08,595 --> 00:07:11,639
-Learn what?
-About you.

79
00:07:11,681 --> 00:07:16,061
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

80
00:07:16,102 --> 00:07:19,606
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

81
00:07:20,398 --> 00:07:22,567
I understand you now.

82
00:07:22,567 --> 00:07:26,196
I remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

83
00:07:26,237 --> 00:07:31,743
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

84
00:07:31,785 --> 00:07:36,331
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

85
00:07:37,290 --> 00:07:40,418
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

86
00:07:40,460 --> 00:07:43,046
We use your dead as vessels.

87
00:09:52,717 --> 00:09:53,718
Get in!

88
00:10:09,192 --> 00:10:13,113
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when I left her.

89
00:10:13,154 --> 00:10:16,199
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

90
00:10:16,241 --> 00:10:18,451
It must mean something--
all those pictures.

91
00:10:18,493 --> 00:10:19,494
What pictures?

92
00:10:20,954 --> 00:10:23,832
-I don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

93
00:10:23,873 --> 00:10:26,334
-Stop telling me lies.
-I am not telling lies!

94
00:10:26,376 --> 00:10:28,712
Help me out.
Make me understand.

95
00:10:28,753 --> 00:10:33,717
I have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

96
00:10:33,758 --> 00:10:37,095
You think it makes sense to me?
I'm as confused as you are.

97
00:10:37,137 --> 00:10:41,057
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

98
00:10:41,099 --> 00:10:43,226
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

99
00:10:43,268 --> 00:10:44,936
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

100
00:10:45,520 --> 00:10:50,775
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

101
00:10:50,817 --> 00:10:52,444
Give me a second, will you?

102
00:10:54,404 --> 00:10:55,989
You can't remember, can you?

103
00:10:57,407 --> 00:10:59,909
Thinking that's kind of odd?

104
00:11:01,119 --> 00:11:03,204
Wait. I got a better one.

105
00:11:03,246 --> 00:11:07,000
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

106
00:11:07,625 --> 00:11:10,587
-What do you mean?
-I just mean during the day.

107
00:11:11,796 --> 00:11:14,549
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

108
00:11:14,591 --> 00:11:18,303
I'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

109
00:11:18,345 --> 00:11:21,097
I mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

110
00:11:22,057 --> 00:11:23,808
Do you have a single memory?

111
00:11:25,602 --> 00:11:27,312
You don't, do you?

112
00:11:27,354 --> 00:11:32,901
I don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

113
00:11:32,942 --> 00:11:37,155
'Cause I've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

114
00:11:37,697 --> 00:11:39,991
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

115
00:11:40,033 --> 00:11:43,661
But listen to me, Bumstead.
It's not just me.

116
00:11:43,661 --> 00:11:46,581
It's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

117
00:11:46,664 --> 00:11:48,500
Shut up.
I've heard enough.

118
00:11:48,500 --> 00:11:51,252
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

119
00:12:01,680 --> 00:12:04,516
There has to be an explanation.

120
00:12:11,856 --> 00:12:12,857
Explain this.

121
00:12:34,713 --> 00:12:36,214
I'm so sorry.

122
00:12:37,257 --> 00:12:40,218
I never meant to hurt you.
I don't know why I did.

123
00:12:40,218 --> 00:12:42,053
I wish I could take it back.

124
00:12:42,721 --> 00:12:45,056
You didn't do it.

125
00:12:45,056 --> 00:12:46,766
This affair of yours,

126
00:12:46,808 --> 00:12:49,894
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

127
00:12:49,894 --> 00:12:51,104
I don't believe it happened.

128
00:12:51,146 --> 00:12:54,941
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

129
00:12:54,983 --> 00:12:58,111
What if we never knew
each other before now?

130
00:12:58,153 --> 00:13:04,409
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

131
00:13:04,409 --> 00:13:07,162
And everything you remember,

132
00:13:07,245 --> 00:13:10,415
and everything I'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

133
00:13:10,457 --> 00:13:12,917
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

134
00:13:13,918 --> 00:13:15,420
But how can that be true?

135
00:13:16,004 --> 00:13:19,007
I so vividly remember
meeting you.

136
00:13:20,300 --> 00:13:22,677
I remember falling in love
with you.

137
00:13:24,262 --> 00:13:27,265
-I remember losing you.
-Time's up.

138
00:13:28,808 --> 00:13:33,605
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

139
00:13:40,111 --> 00:13:41,613
I love you, John.

140
00:13:45,033 --> 00:13:47,202
You can't fake something
like that.

141
00:13:48,870 --> 00:13:50,372
No, you can't.

142
00:14:19,651 --> 00:14:22,195
Inspector? Sir?

143
00:14:23,655 --> 00:14:26,324
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

144
00:14:28,660 --> 00:14:30,078
I thought you should know.

145
00:14:32,706 --> 00:14:37,043
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

146
00:14:44,009 --> 00:14:45,844
I knew you'd track
the killer down.

147
00:15:01,359 --> 00:15:02,527
Shoelace.

148
00:15:15,707 --> 00:15:18,877
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

149
00:15:22,255 --> 00:15:23,965
Sleep. Sleep.

150
00:15:27,761 --> 00:15:28,928
Evening.

151
00:15:41,775 --> 00:15:45,403
I wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

152
00:15:47,947 --> 00:15:50,784
Take us to Murdoch.

153
00:15:50,825 --> 00:15:51,826
Sleep.

154
00:16:22,315 --> 00:16:23,942
I knew you'd come eventually.

155
00:16:23,983 --> 00:16:26,486
Isn't it time
you gave me some answers?

156
00:16:27,821 --> 00:16:30,532
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

157
00:16:33,827 --> 00:16:35,662
I come here often.

158
00:16:35,704 --> 00:16:38,289
It's one of the few places
I'm allowed some peace.

159
00:16:38,707 --> 00:16:41,793
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

160
00:16:42,794 --> 00:16:44,796
One could almost call it
a phobia.

161
00:16:45,213 --> 00:16:47,841
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

162
00:16:47,882 --> 00:16:48,883
Right.

163
00:16:49,634 --> 00:16:54,347
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

164
00:16:54,347 --> 00:16:55,849
We all are.

165
00:16:57,517 --> 00:17:03,356
I'm sorry, but I have no time
to do this the right way.

166
00:17:03,356 --> 00:17:07,360
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

167
00:17:07,402 --> 00:17:10,989
I need you to inject yourself.
It's the only way to understand.

168
00:17:11,031 --> 00:17:13,867
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

169
00:17:13,867 --> 00:17:17,537
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

170
00:17:17,537 --> 00:17:19,706
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

171
00:17:19,748 --> 00:17:22,667
I may not be the judge
of personality you are,

172
00:17:22,709 --> 00:17:25,670
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

173
00:17:25,712 --> 00:17:28,214
You don't know what
you're doing.

174
00:17:29,382 --> 00:17:33,345
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

175
00:17:35,055 --> 00:17:38,183
All the answers you've been
looking for, I swear to you.

176
00:17:40,101 --> 00:17:45,899
Guess I'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

177
00:17:45,899 --> 00:17:47,233
Let's go, Doctor.

178
00:17:48,777 --> 00:17:51,946
Go? Where are we going?

179
00:17:52,405 --> 00:17:54,115
Shell Beach.

180
00:17:55,241 --> 00:17:58,703
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

181
00:18:07,545 --> 00:18:10,924
Won't find anything there.
I've been there--

182
00:18:10,965 --> 00:18:13,301
Then you can show us the way.

183
00:18:13,385 --> 00:18:17,055
I won't. I refuse.
You can't make me go there.

184
00:18:17,097 --> 00:18:19,474
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

185
00:18:28,775 --> 00:18:33,279
I don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

186
00:18:38,618 --> 00:18:41,746
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

187
00:18:41,788 --> 00:18:43,581
Don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

188
00:18:43,623 --> 00:18:45,333
It doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

189
00:18:52,257 --> 00:18:53,258
What?

190
00:18:56,636 --> 00:18:58,138
Who are you people?

191
00:18:58,596 --> 00:19:01,349
Must go to the end
of the canal.

192
00:19:02,642 --> 00:19:05,311
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

193
00:19:06,479 --> 00:19:08,815
-Anna.
-I'm not Anna.

194
00:19:10,483 --> 00:19:12,485
You will be soon, yes.

195
00:19:16,781 --> 00:19:19,617
I have another use
for her first.

196
00:19:29,127 --> 00:19:31,004
I call them Strangers.

197
00:19:31,546 --> 00:19:34,049
They abducted us
and brought us here.

198
00:19:35,216 --> 00:19:39,679
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

199
00:19:39,679 --> 00:19:42,390
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

200
00:19:42,390 --> 00:19:45,060
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

201
00:19:45,560 --> 00:19:48,396
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

202
00:19:48,480 --> 00:19:51,232
The next,
someone entirely different.

203
00:19:51,649 --> 00:19:55,070
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

204
00:19:55,070 --> 00:19:59,574
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

205
00:19:59,574 --> 00:20:03,870
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

206
00:20:03,912 --> 00:20:05,747
even a lost wallet.

207
00:20:05,830 --> 00:20:07,916
Then they observe the results.

208
00:20:09,209 --> 00:20:13,380
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

209
00:20:13,880 --> 00:20:17,425
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

210
00:20:17,509 --> 00:20:22,055
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

211
00:20:22,722 --> 00:20:25,266
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

212
00:20:25,350 --> 00:20:26,768
You happened to wake up...

213
00:20:26,768 --> 00:20:29,604
while I was imprinting you
with this one.

214
00:20:29,688 --> 00:20:31,606
Why are they doing all this?

215
00:20:31,731 --> 00:20:35,860
It is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

216
00:20:35,902 --> 00:20:37,737
that makes us different
from them.

217
00:20:37,737 --> 00:20:40,240
They think they'll find
the human soul...

218
00:20:40,240 --> 00:20:42,951
if they understand
how our memories work.

219
00:20:42,951 --> 00:20:47,455
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

220
00:20:47,455 --> 00:20:52,377
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

221
00:20:52,419 --> 00:20:55,422
-They think we can save them.
-Where do I fit in?

222
00:20:55,463 --> 00:20:59,968
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

223
00:21:04,931 --> 00:21:08,393
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

224
00:21:08,435 --> 00:21:11,646
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

225
00:21:11,730 --> 00:21:14,607
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

226
00:21:14,649 --> 00:21:18,153
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

227
00:21:18,945 --> 00:21:21,573
They control everything here,
even the sun.

228
00:21:21,614 --> 00:21:24,784
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

229
00:21:24,826 --> 00:21:26,286
Why do they need you?

230
00:21:26,327 --> 00:21:28,288
When they first brought us here,

231
00:21:28,288 --> 00:21:32,625
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

232
00:21:32,667 --> 00:21:34,586
remixed it like paint...

233
00:21:34,627 --> 00:21:37,130
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

234
00:21:37,172 --> 00:21:40,800
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

235
00:21:42,510 --> 00:21:47,515
I understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

236
00:21:47,515 --> 00:21:51,144
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

237
00:21:51,186 --> 00:21:52,645
because they needed them.

238
00:21:52,687 --> 00:21:55,106
They made me delete
everything else.

239
00:22:03,698 --> 00:22:08,161
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

240
00:22:08,203 --> 00:22:11,456
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

241
00:22:12,332 --> 00:22:14,376
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

242
00:22:15,627 --> 00:22:19,714
What about this?
This was blank when I found it.

243
00:22:19,714 --> 00:22:23,635
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

244
00:22:23,677 --> 00:22:24,969
Not in this place.

245
00:22:25,011 --> 00:22:27,889
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

246
00:22:27,889 --> 00:22:29,724
as it is with all of us.

247
00:22:29,808 --> 00:22:32,310
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

248
00:22:32,352 --> 00:22:33,853
You say they brought us here.

249
00:22:36,231 --> 00:22:37,232
From where?

250
00:22:41,069 --> 00:22:44,239
I'm sorry. I don't remember.

251
00:22:45,073 --> 00:22:49,327
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

252
00:22:49,369 --> 00:22:52,914
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

253
00:23:10,724 --> 00:23:14,477
I've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

254
00:23:14,519 --> 00:23:15,478
Let's go.

255
00:24:00,899 --> 00:24:03,151
There is no ocean, John.

256
00:24:04,444 --> 00:24:06,571
There's nothing beyond the city.

257
00:24:08,198 --> 00:24:10,700
The only place home exists...

258
00:24:12,911 --> 00:24:14,496
is in your head.

259
00:24:25,924 --> 00:24:26,925
Stop!

260
00:24:40,021 --> 00:24:41,022
Please!

261
00:25:01,876 --> 00:25:04,004
Now you know the truth.

262
00:26:03,563 --> 00:26:06,232
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

263
00:26:06,274 --> 00:26:08,568
or it will result in
this one's death.

264
00:26:08,610 --> 00:26:09,819
What do I care?

265
00:26:10,278 --> 00:26:12,364
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

266
00:26:12,405 --> 00:26:17,077
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

267
00:26:17,118 --> 00:26:21,373
I have become the monster
you were intended to be.

268
00:26:23,333 --> 00:26:26,878
Shall I end her life now,
as you would have?

269
00:26:30,423 --> 00:26:35,720
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

270
00:26:37,931 --> 00:26:38,890
Sleep.

271
00:26:41,059 --> 00:26:42,018
Now.

272
00:27:01,329 --> 00:27:02,330
Sleep.

273
00:27:11,381 --> 00:27:12,757
Kill him.

274
00:27:12,799 --> 00:27:13,800
Kill him !

275
00:27:24,352 --> 00:27:27,814
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

276
00:27:27,856 --> 00:27:31,192
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

277
00:27:31,234 --> 00:27:34,404
what the doctor calls the soul.

278
00:27:34,446 --> 00:27:38,408
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

279
00:27:38,450 --> 00:27:41,244
We no longer need
the other subjects.

280
00:27:41,286 --> 00:27:44,664
The time for study is over.

281
00:27:44,664 --> 00:27:49,002
It is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

282
00:27:55,842 --> 00:27:59,179
It is time, Doctor. Imprint.

283
00:28:01,848 --> 00:28:04,017
Shut it down!

284
00:28:04,934 --> 00:28:07,354
Shut it down forever.

285
00:28:21,993 --> 00:28:23,078
What are you doing?

286
00:28:23,995 --> 00:28:28,708
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

287
00:28:29,793 --> 00:28:32,003
They want to make you
one of them...

288
00:28:32,045 --> 00:28:34,214
so they can share your soul.

289
00:28:34,255 --> 00:28:36,591
But I've got other plans.

290
00:28:39,969 --> 00:28:42,847
Imprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

291
00:28:42,889 --> 00:28:47,519
I'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

292
00:28:58,655 --> 00:29:00,365
Remember, John.

293
00:29:01,366 --> 00:29:03,410
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

294
00:29:03,451 --> 00:29:05,912
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

295
00:29:07,247 --> 00:29:08,206
Remember.

296
00:29:09,582 --> 00:29:12,419
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

297
00:29:12,460 --> 00:29:15,714
Now, remember what I told you.
Never talk to strangers.

298
00:29:16,089 --> 00:29:17,424
John, remember.

299
00:29:17,632 --> 00:29:20,427
You're probably wondering why I
keep appearing in your memories.

300
00:29:20,468 --> 00:29:22,887
It's because I have
inserted myself in them.

301
00:29:22,929 --> 00:29:26,891
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

302
00:29:26,933 --> 00:29:30,061
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

303
00:29:32,897 --> 00:29:37,569
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

304
00:29:37,610 --> 00:29:39,154
And you will prevail.

305
00:29:39,821 --> 00:29:40,947
Remember.

306
00:29:41,656 --> 00:29:43,908
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

307
00:29:46,828 --> 00:29:50,957
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day I'll work for you.

308
00:29:51,583 --> 00:29:55,211
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

309
00:29:55,253 --> 00:29:57,005
the machine that changes
their world.

310
00:29:57,047 --> 00:30:00,300
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

311
00:30:00,342 --> 00:30:04,929
I know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

312
00:30:06,973 --> 00:30:08,183
Something's wrong.

313
00:30:16,983 --> 00:30:18,860
There is no time for romance.

314
00:30:18,902 --> 00:30:20,987
The world can be
what you make it.

315
00:30:21,988 --> 00:30:23,073
What have you done?

316
00:30:24,157 --> 00:30:26,284
You have the power
to make anything happen...

317
00:30:26,368 --> 00:30:28,286
but you must act now.

318
00:35:12,612 --> 00:35:16,866
I knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

319
00:35:16,950 --> 00:35:19,202
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

320
00:35:20,328 --> 00:35:24,833
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

321
00:35:24,833 --> 00:35:27,127
-So give her back her memories.
-I can't.

322
00:35:27,168 --> 00:35:31,214
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

323
00:35:32,007 --> 00:35:33,008
I'm sorry.

324
00:35:34,467 --> 00:35:36,386
What are you going to do now?

325
00:35:39,389 --> 00:35:40,890
I'm gonna fix things.

326
00:35:42,517 --> 00:35:45,854
You told me I had the power,
didn't you?

327
00:35:46,813 --> 00:35:49,733
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

328
00:35:50,817 --> 00:35:52,861
Make this world
anything I want it to be.

329
00:35:54,070 --> 00:35:58,158
Just so long as I concentrate
hard enough.

330
00:37:21,783 --> 00:37:23,076
Where are you going?

331
00:37:26,496 --> 00:37:27,497
Shell Beach.

332
00:38:08,872 --> 00:38:10,373
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

333
00:38:17,172 --> 00:38:18,882
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

334
00:38:20,175 --> 00:38:21,176
Thank you.

335
00:39:07,222 --> 00:39:09,182
Been waiting for you, yes?

336
00:39:09,891 --> 00:39:14,187
-What are you doing?
-I'm just making a few changes.

337
00:39:14,229 --> 00:39:19,109
-We're sure that's what we want?
-I'll take my chances.

338
00:39:19,192 --> 00:39:24,948
I'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

339
00:39:25,031 --> 00:39:27,200
But I wanted to know
what it was like.

340
00:39:28,910 --> 00:39:30,537
How you feel.

341
00:39:30,620 --> 00:39:33,289
You know how I was
supposed to feel.

342
00:39:33,289 --> 00:39:37,419
That person isn't me.
Never was.

343
00:39:37,460 --> 00:39:40,630
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

344
00:39:41,756 --> 00:39:45,552
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

345
00:39:47,137 --> 00:39:48,972
You went looking
in the wrong place.

346
00:41:28,196 --> 00:41:29,989
It's so beautiful here.

347
00:41:35,412 --> 00:41:36,705
So bright.

348
00:41:43,003 --> 00:41:45,046
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

349
00:41:45,755 --> 00:41:48,174
I think that's it over there.

350
00:42:06,401 --> 00:42:08,403
I'm headed that way myself.

351
00:42:10,405 --> 00:42:11,740
Would you like to join me?

352
00:42:14,909 --> 00:42:15,869
Sure.

353
00:42:21,291 --> 00:42:24,878
I'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?
